intro: Eubrachion ambiguum, commonly known as the ambiguous brachion, is a rare aquatic plant belonging to the order Charales. It is characterized by its simple, filamentous structure and lacks true roots, stems, and leaves, instead having a thallus composed of loosely arranged cells. The plant thrives in freshwater environments, particularly in slow-moving streams and ponds with soft, muddy substrates. Its reproductive structures are specialized, with sporangia forming on the upper portions of the thallus. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Eubrachion ambiguum is considered a sensitive indicator of water quality and ecological health.
